original: Laurin, Adolf Decimus, redaktör, Linköping, f. 22/9/83 i Vimmerby av fabr. J. A. L. o. Matilda Jonsson. G. 1. 07 m. Elvira Landgren; 2. 26 m. Ulla Winblad. Barn: Adde f. 10, 1 :e tra-fiking. i Gbgs byggn:nd, Inge 16, fo- togr. lab:chef, Sthlm. — Mog:ex. i Norrköp. 03. Lär. v. Solbacka lärov. 03-04, medarb. i Sthlms-Tidn. 04-20. red. av Sthlms Läns Tidn. 20, bruks-förv. v. A-B Mälardalens Tegelbruk i Södertälje 20-22, reklamch. h. John Fröberg i Finspång 22-23, medarb. i tidn. Ö’Stgöten sed. 23, red. f. Fören. östergötl. barns medl :blad Blåklinten sed. 32, redig, östg :journalisternas tidn. Påskaris o. Barnens Dags Tidn. i Linköp. Sign.: Rinaldo, Fliaj. Medl. av Publ :klubben o. Journ :fören., rev. i den sistn. Sthlmskrets 17-18. Resor t. Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Frankr., Ös-terr., Ital., Belg., Holl., Finl. o. Engl., tidvis som krigskorresp. UngFO.
translated: Laurin, Adolf Decimus, editor, Linköping, b. 22/9/83 in Vimmerby, son of the factory worker J. A. L. and Matilda Jonsson. Married 1. in 1907 to Elvira Landgren; 2. in 1926 to Ulla Winblad. Children: Adde, b. 1910, works in the construction industry in Gothenburg, Inge, b. 1916, works as a photography lab manager in Stockholm. Completed secondary education in Norrköping in 1903. Teacher at Solbacka School 1903-1904, contributor to Sthlms-Tidn. 1904-1920. Editor of Sthlms Läns Tidn. from 1920, manager at A-B Mälardalens Tegelbruk in Södertälje from 1920-1922, advertising manager at John Fröberg in Finspång from 1922-1923, contributor to the newspaper Ö’Stgöten since 1923, editor for the Association of Östergötland Children's Monthly Magazine Blåklinten since 1932, editor of the East Gothland Journalists' Newspaper Påskaris and Barnens Dags Tidn. in Linköping. Pen names: Rinaldo, Fliaj. Member of the Publicist Club and Journalists' Association, reviewer in the latter's Stockholm district 1917-1918. Travels to Norway, Denmark, Germany, France, Austria, Italy, Belgium, Netherlands, Finland, and England, occasionally as a war correspondent. Young FO (volunteer soldier during World War I).

work.name: Association of Östergötland Children's Monthly Magazine Blåklinten
